solution_line_template: First multiply Marla's one-way driving time by {round_trip_multiplier} to find her total driving time: {driving_time_one_way} minutes * {round_trip_multiplier} = <<{driving_time_one_way}*{round_trip_multiplier}={total_driving_time}>>{total_driving_time} minutes

Then add Marla's driving time to the time spent attending the conference to find the total time: {conference_time} minutes + {total_driving_time} minutes = <<{conference_time}+{total_driving_time}={total_errand_time}>>{total_errand_time} minutes
